messageBody:
On Fri, 2003-05-30 at 14:29, Robert McBroom wrote:
> I agree that, for me too, QS has proven a write-only language. I have
> developed speed in writing, but reading speed seems not to have
> improved in a year's work. I'm glad to see that I'm not alone in this
> phenomenon. There must be two different parts of the brain at work
> for coding, and uncoding the information.

I wonder if an orthography could be *designed* for ease of reading
first, with other concerns such as pen lifts and space secondary.

One thing that would definitely help would be to reduce the number of
glyphs which look similar when rotated or reversed. Shavian has many of
these. Read mentioned somewhere that reducing the number of these was a
goal for QS. Perhaps a read-friendly orthography would have none of
them.

- Mitch
